alert.note: Alert for Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 3:50PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rockingham and southwestern Pittsylvania Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 350 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cascade, or near Mayfield, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Eden... Mayfield... Aiken Summit... Cascade... and Draper. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
